sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• usual dose 60 mg once daily
  • safety and efficacy have not been established in patients with decompensated liver disease; pre-, peri-, or post-liver or other organ transplantation; or coinfection with HIV or hepatitis B virus
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 1 with compensated cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir: 60 mg ORALLY once daily in combination with sofosbuvir for 24 weeks; may reduce treatment to 12 weeks in treatment-naive patients with positive prognostic factors (ie, IL28B CC genotype and/or low baseline viral load); for patients with advanced disease or other negative prognostic factors (ie, previous treatment exposure) consider adding ribavirin (1000 mg for body weight less than 75 kg; 1200 mg for weight 75 kg or more) (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 1 without cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir: 60 mg ORALLY once daily in combination with sofosbuvir for 12 weeks; may consider extending treatment to 24 weeks in patients who have received prior treatment with NS3/4A protease inhibitor (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 3 with compensated cirrhosis and/or treatment experienced, as a component of a combination antiviral treatment regimen: 60 mg ORALLY once daily in combination with sofosbuvir and ribavirin (1000 mg for body weight less than 75 kg; 1200 mg for weight 75 kg or more) for 24 weeks
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 4, in combination with peginterferon alfa and ribavirin: 60 mg ORALLY once daily for 24 weeks in combination with peginterferon alfa and ribavirin (1000 mg for body weight less than 75 kg; 1200 mg for weight 75 kg or more) for 24 to 48 weeks (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing).
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 4 with compensated cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir: 60 mg ORALLY once daily in combination with sofosbuvir for 24 weeks; may reduce duration to 12 weeks in treatment-naive patients with positive prognostic factors (ie, IL28B CC genotype and/or low baseline viral load); for patients with advanced disease or other negative prognostic factors (ie, previous treatment exposure) consider adding ribavirin (1000 mg for body weight less than 75 kg; 1200 mg for weight 75 kg or more) (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 4 without cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir: 60 mg ORALLY once daily in combination with sofosbuvir for 12 weeks; may consider extending treatment to 24 weeks in patients who have received prior treatment with NS3/4A protease inhibitor (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and efficacy have not been established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• dose reduction to manage adverse reactions is not recommended
  • renal impairment: No adjustment is necessary
  • hepatic impairment: No adjustment is necessary
  • geriatric: No adjustment is necessary .
  • discontinue combination therapy of daclatasvir plus peginterferon alfa and ribavirin if the HCV RNA threshold at treatment week 4 exceeds 1000 international units/mL or is 25 international units/mL or greater at weeks 12 or 24; discontinuation parameters do apply when daclatasvir is used in combination with sofosbuvir
  • in combination with strong inhibitors of CYP3A4, reduce daclatasvir to 30 mg once daily
  • in combination with moderate inducers of CYP3A4, increase daclatasvir to 90 mg once daily

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 1 with compensated cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 1 without cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 3 with compensated cirrhosis and/or treatment experienced, as a component of a combination antiviral treatment regimen
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 4, in combination with peginterferon alfa and ribavirin
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 4 with compensated cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir
  • Hepatitis C, chronic, Genotype 4 without cirrhosis, in combination with sofosbuvir

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• concomitant use with strong CYP3A4 and P-gp inducers (eg, carbamazepine, oxcarbazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin, rifabutin, rifampicin, rifapentine, systemic dexamethasone, St John's wort)
  • hypersensitivity to daclatasvir or other components of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Reproductive:
  • -- use is not recommended during pregnancy or in women of childbearing potential not using contraception; patient should use highly-effective contraception during therapy and for 5 weeks following completion
  • Other:
  • -- product contains lactose; use is not recommended in galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency, or glucose-galactose malabsorption
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- use with darunavir, etravirine, lopinavir, and nevirapine not recommended

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea (10% or greater)
  • Neurologic:Headache (10% or greater)
  • Other:Fatigue (10% or greater)
Serious
Hematologic:Anemia, Grade 3 or higher (1% or greater), Lymphocytopenia, Grade 3 or higher (1% or greater), Neutropenia, Grade 3 or higher (1% or greater)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Daclatasvir is a nonstructural protein 5A (NS5A) inhibitor that interferes with the hepatitis C virus replication complex via inhibition of viral RNA replication and virion assembly. Daclatasvir is highly selective for HCV.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax, oral: 1 to 2 hours
  • Bioavailability, oral: 67%
  • Effects of food: High fat meal, decrease Cmax 28%, decrease AUC 23%; light meal, no effect on exposure

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Liver: primary site via CYP3A4
  • inhibitor of P-glycoprotein (P-gp), OATP 1B1, and BCRP
  • substrate of CYP3A4 and P-gp

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Fecal: 88% total, 53% unchanged
  • Renal: 6.6% primarily unchanged
  • Dialyzable: No (hemodialysis)
  • Total body clearance: 4.24 L/hr

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    monotherapy not recommended; always administer in combination with sofosbuvir and/or ribavirin or peginterferon alfa and/or ribavirin
  • Oral
    may take with or without food

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• hepatitis C genotype: prior to initiation of therapy
  • hepatitis C RNA load: during therapy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Recommend female patient avoid pregnancy during therapy and for 5 weeks post-treatment.
  • Side effects may include fatigue, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, vomiting, depression, anxiety, insomnia, dizziness, dyspnea, pruritus, alopecia, rash, arthralgia, or myalgia.
  • Instruct patient to take a missed dose as soon as possible, but if next dose is in less than 4 hours, skip the missed dose.
